description: From French immunisation. Coined by Albert Calmette. Equivalent to immunize +â€Ž -ation.

entries.meaning: (US, uncountable) The process by which an individual is safely exposed in a controlled manner to a material that is designed to prime their immune system against that material.
examples: Immunization against influenza is important for all child-care workers.
The first immunization a baby gets is against HBV.
